page.title: 04Ecology-Wild Life Garden.
page.content: At Annitsford First School,a wild-life garden is being developed on land next to the school.The project undertaken in conjunction with the British Trust for Conservation Volunteers and Manpower Services Commission began in May 1983. The area will be used as an educational resource and an amenity area for the local community especially the elderly. The Garden may encourage more wildlife into the area.An established pond managed by the Northumberland Wild-life Trust edges onto it.Sections include wooded areas,chequer board,fern and butterfly gardens,pond rockery,and meadow grasslands.Manpower is supplied by Community Industry and funds are from Shell U.K.,local firms and interest groups.Children have planted 200 trees,grown hundreds of wild flowers designed sections and will help in looking after the area.Cost=$2000.
